info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 10:12AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FAIRFIELD AND NORTHWESTERN HOCKING COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 AM EDT... At 1012 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Lancaster, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Bremen, Pleasantville, Hide-A-Way Hills, Royalton, Amanda, Thurston, Sugar Grove, Rushville, West Rushville, Fairfield County Airport, US Route 22 at State Route 159, Buena Vista in Hocking County, Hideaway Hills, Clearport, North Berne, Enterprise, Rockbridge and Dumontville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
